intro: Tanacetum atratum, commonly known as the black snakeroot, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its foliage has a strong, aromatic scent, and it is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Tanacetum atratum is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
